author: lightclient
content: How does the cross link committee determine what the root of the shard is that they are attesting to?

author: lightclient
content: My understanding is that they ask the persistent committee because surely they aren't executing the shard -- right?

author: djrtwo
content: The crosslink committee syncs the shard since the latest crosslink and executes the fork choice rule to find the head. In phase 0, there is no state execution so it is just the fork choice on the data chain. In phase 2, the expectation is to run the state transitions in the state-less EE model, this can be done simply via the data contained in the blocks (merkle state witnesses are embedded) and thus no full state sync has to occur.

author: djrtwo
content: So they _do_ execute the actual shard transitions

author: djrtwo
content: When crosslinking, they are making a claim on the availability and validity of the data

author: djrtwo
content:
proof of custody games handle the availability portion.
fraud proofs will handle validity
